issue.title: cmake: unable to build binaries from my fork repo but can do so from bitcoin repo
issue.body:
macOS 15.1

Not sure if it's a bug or something I missed.
I can build the binaries fine when I do so from my `projects/bitcoin` but I get the following error when I build from my fork repo here `projects/rkrux/bitcoin`.

```
âžœ  bitcoin git:(master) cmake --build build -j 13
...
...
make[2]: *** No rule to make target `/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/SDKs/MacOSX14.4.sdk/usr/lib/libsqlite3.tbd', needed by `src/bitcoind'.  Stop.
make[2]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
[ 75%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/bitcoind.dir/bitcoind.cpp.o
[ 76%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/bitcoind.dir/init/bitcoind.cpp.o
make[2]: *** No rule to make target `/Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/SDKs/MacOSX14.4.sdk/usr/lib/libsqlite3.tbd', needed by `src/bitcoin-wallet'.  Stop.
make[1]: *** [src/CMakeFiles/bitcoin-wallet.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
```

The configuration command I used before building.
```
cmake -B build -DBUILD_GUI=OFF -DWITH_BDB=OFF -LH
```

I have not found any issue exactly related to this, please redirect me to one if it has been posted earlier.
